content: Ba­(NO3)2 (0.2 mmol) and trimesic acid (BTC) (0.2 mmol) were dissolved in a mixture of 5 mL each of water and N,N′-dimethylformamide (DMF) in a glass vial by sonication. The solution was transferred to a 20 mL Teflon lined autoclave and placed in a preheated oven at 120 °C for 24 h. The autoclave was cooled to room temperature, and the white crystals obtained were washed with fresh DMF and air-dried before further use.
clean_text:
Materials and Methods

Synthesis

Synthesis of 1-B 

Ba(NO3)2 (0.2 mmol) and trimesic acid (BTC) (0.2 mmol) were dissolved in a mixture of 5 mL each of water and N,N'-dimethylformamide (DMF) in a glass vial by sonication. The solution was transferred to a 20 mL Teflon lined autoclave and placed in a preheated oven at 120 °C for 24 h. The autoclave was cooled to room temperature, and the white crystals obtained were washed with fresh DMF and air-dried before further use.
